summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida to Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys, Jay P. Lefkowitz and Roy Black, regarding the implementation of the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA). It addresses the selection of a Special Master and attorney representative, victim notifications, and clarifies that Epstein's plea resolved liability for all criminal activity known to the U.S. at the time.

events.title: Letter Regarding NPA Implementation
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends a letter to Epstein's attorneys clarifying NPA implementation steps, victim notifications, and the role of the attorney representative.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office states that Jeffrey Epstein's plea agreement resolved liability for 'all criminal activity known to the United States as of the time of his plea and sentencing.'
The Office provided Epstein's counsel with a list of individuals it was prepared to name in an indictment as victims under 18 U.S.C. § 2255, and states 'none of those names will be deleted.'
The author admits to having previously provided victims with 'incorrect information'—though approved by Epstein's counsel—and states it is imperative to correct the error promptly.
A Special Master (Judge Davis) and an attorney representative (Robert Josefsberg) have been selected as part of the Non-Prosecution Agreement implementation.
The letter indicates victim notification letters will be sent, copying Epstein's counsel, and uses a format previously approved by Epstein's attorneys Goldberger and Tein.
